result.execSummary:
The defendant Cruz Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pay all court costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges,  and DNA surcharge.
To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgmet.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearm/body armor; and that voting privleges are suspoended during the length of this sentence.

records.addlTxt: Restitution of $2110.30 ordered in case 13CF5264

Defendant Cruz Hernandez in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Cruz Hernandez in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense indicates that the defendant wants to withdraw his guilty pleas entered on 10-8-2014 and also is requesting new counsel.  Defendant had filed motions with the court that were forwarded to defense counsel.  The state is prepared to proceed with sentencing today.  The state does not believe that the defendant has provided a fair and just reason for withdrawal of his pleas or for new counsel.
The court will pass cases to allow the defendant to discuss how he wishes to proceed today.
Cases recalled.  ADA Paul Tiffin now appears on behalf of the state.
The court has a colloquy with the defendant as to how he wishes to proceed.  Defendant now wishes to proceed with sentencing today.  Defendant withdraws his motions that were filed and is satisfied with the representation of Atty Johnson.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.  Victims were present on a prior date and gave statements to the court.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 12 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 281 days time served, concurrent with 13CF5264.  CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 7 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Defendant to register as a sex offender.
-No contact with victim, SMV, dob 5-14-93
-No unsupervised contact with children under 17 years.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.
Filed:  Notice of right to seek postconviction relief; ineligible voting notice; written explanation of determinate sentence
Memorandum regarding PSI, filed.

Received from defendant: Motion to Produce Discovery and Inspection of All Contents Discoverable Within the Scope of Alleged Crime.
Copy forwarded to Atty Richard Johnson.

Received from defendant: Petition to Withdraw Guilty Plea.
Copy forwarded to Atty Richard Johnson.
for PSI

Defendant Cruz Hernandez in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Cruz Hernandez in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter is set for sentencing today.  Defendant is requesting an adjournment until late November to allow for his family to be present (currently in Mexico).  The state takes no position as the victims were present at the last date and provided statements to the court.
The court will grant the adjournment but will order a PSI to be completed.
Case is adjourned to 12-3- 2014 at 8:15 for sentencing.

Defendant Cruz Hernandez in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Cruz Hernandez in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State was prepared to proceed to trial; victims will be arriving by 10am this morning from out of state.
Defendant now wishes to resolve matter.
State moves to amend charge to SECOND DEGREE SEXUAL ASSAULT OF A CHILD, a class C felony pursuant to 948.02(2).
To the amended charge:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty of amended charge and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Defendant would like to proceed to sentencing today.  Case passed to allow victims to appear and provide impact statement.
CASE RECALLED.  Defendant now wishes to have another sentencing date.
The State filed restitution information to which the defendant stipulated to payment in the amount of $2110.30.
Statements to the court from: Amanda A. and Angela T.
Parties waive presentence investigation.  Sentencing is adjourned to 10-22-2014 at 8:15am.  Defendant remanded.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Attorney Richard J. Johnson in court, defendant Cruz Hernandez not in court, in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
WRITTEN SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND filed on 8-19-2014.  Parties are prepared to proceed to trial on 10-8-2014.
Demand for Speedy trial received and filed.

Defendant Cruz Hernandez in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Cruz Hernandez in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State's motion to adjourn jury trial of 8-11-2014 due to witness' inability to travel from Ohio is heard and not objected to by the defense.  Court will grant the adjournment and vacate the 8-11-2014 jury.
Case set for final pretrial on 9-4-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 10-8-2014 at 8:15am.

to Adjourn 8-11-2014 jury trial filed by the state.
Motion set for 8-4-2014 at 8:15am.

Defendant Cruz Hernandez in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Cruz Hernandez in custody.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was going to request new counsel, but is withdrawing that request and will proceed to trial on 8-11-2014.
Court advises counsel that if this matter is going to resolve it should be done prior to the trial date.

Attorney Richard J Johnson in court, defendant Cruz Hernandez not in court, in custody.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Richard Johnson contacts the court to advise he is in trial in Branch 34 at 8:30 and unable to appear.  Case is adjourned to 6-23-2014 at 8:15 for final pretrial.

Attorney Richard J Johnson in court, defendant Cruz Hernandez not in court, in custody.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defense is requesting another final pretrial date; State may be filing OTHER ACTS motion.
State's Witness List filed.
Another final pretrial is set for 6-18-2014 at 8:15.

Defendant Cruz Hernandez in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Cruz Hernandez in custody.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State is moving to consolidate with 13CF5264 pursuant to 971.12(4); the defense does not object.  The Court orders that cases be consolidated.
The State is moving to adjourn the trial date of 5-19-2014 in 14CF779 as detective is unavailable for trial.  Defense has no objection to the adjournment.
The Court will convert the trial date of 5-19-2014 to a final pretrial and set a new trial date of 8-11-2014.
to Adjourn filed by state.
to Consolidate Cases for Trial filed by the State.

Attorney Richard J. Johnson in court, defendant Cruz Hernandez not in court, in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 State will be moving to join with 13CF5264.  Case set for final pretrial on 4-29-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 5-19-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed within 17 days of today's date.

Defendant Cruz Hernandez in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Cruz Hernandez in custody.  Paul Hauer for Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SMV dob 5/14/93

Defendant Cruz Hernandez in court with attorney Anne Jaspers.  Defendant Cruz Hernandez in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
